thread.title: Motorist fatally shot by officer on I-75 in Bartow County...
thread.title_full: Motorist fatally shot by officer on I-75 in Bartow County... | www.ajc.com

author: Breaking News Staff
title: Motorist fatally shot by officer on I-75 in Bartow County...
text:
Authorities have released the name of the motorist who was fatally shot by an Emerson police officer during a Wednesday traffic stop on I-75 in Bartow County.
Brent Andrew Brannon, 27, of Columbus, was fatally shot by an Emerson police officer after Brannon allegedly brandished a weapon after being pulled over during a traffic stop, Georgia Bureau of Investigation spokesman Scott Dutton said Thursday.
Emerson Officer Robert K. Smith, 24, was working traffic enforcement on I-75 when he pulled Brannon over after being alerted of a tag violation, Dutton said. A driver’s license check alerted Smith that Brannon should be considered armed and dangerous and was an escape risk, Dutton said.
Authorities were on the scene of a fatal shooting on northbound I-75 in Bartow County on Wednesday. Channel 2 Action News Dutton said Brannon also was wanted on outstanding warrants for trafficking in heroin, possession of a sawed off rifle, sale of marijuana, and possession of drug paraphernalia from the Columbus Police Department.
Smith requested backup, but before it arrived, Brannon “became non-compliant and Officer Smith deployed his Taser at him, Dutton said. He added the Taser “was ineffective and Brannon pointed a handgun at Officer Smith.” Smith fired at Brannon striking and killing him, Dutton said.
The incident was captured on the officer’s dash cam video, Dutton added.
Brannon’s body will be transported to the GBI Medical Examiner’s Office in Decatur for an autopsy scheduled for Friday, Dutton said.
